subsection.name: Prepare your build.properties
subsection.p:
To be able to install your applications into a servlet container, you must either use inplace deployment or add the location of your web container to your build.properties (If you're writing web applications with maven, this is a good idea anyway). You should add a line like this:
For Unix: maven.appserver.home = /opt/jakarta-tomcat-5.0.24
For Windows: maven.appserver.home = C:/Program Files/Apache Software Foundation/Tomcat-5.0.24
Please make sure that you do not add the webapp subdirectory to this property!
On Windows, you must use the slash ("/"), not the backslash!.

Now enter this subdirectory. META has set up the skeleton of your application for you. It even contains a welcome page to show you that everything is fine. Lets compile and deploy the application to your web container to check this out:
maven turbine:deploy
Now do the necessary steps that your web container requires to reload an application in its webapp directory. Point your browser to the application (if you use Tomcat running on your local machine, this would be http://localhost:8080/helloworld/app/). It should look like this:
